Detailed Description

Access IP network.

To build an asynchonous client connection, it can be done by

Signal handler for SIGPIPE is necessary when using ClientSocket. Signal handler function (sigpipeHandler) will be invoked by following code: signal(SIGPIPE,sigpipeHandler); OR just ignore SIGPIPE signal by using signal(SIGPIPE,SIG_IGN)

 ClientSocket sck;
 sck.addSocketListener(l); // l should be a pointer to an implementation
                           // IClientSocketListener
 sck.connect(IPEndPoint(IP4Address(10, 8, 49, 63), 50000));

Definition at line 43 of file ClientSocket.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::net::ClientSocket::ClientSocket ( )

Create a socket in default address domain.

Create a socket in IPv4, Connection-oriented mode.

gaia::net::ClientSocket::ClientSocket ( NetAddressFamily  addrFamily,
NetSocketType  type,
int32_t  proto 
)

Create a socket with specifying address domain.

To create an IPv6 socket, use following code 

 ClientSocket *socket = new ClientSocket(SOCKET_INET6);
Parameters:
addrFamilyAddress domain of this socket.
typeConnection-oriented or datagram.
protoProtocol in integer. It is protocol number that specified in /etc/protocols, or just 0 for default protocol.
virtual gaia::net::ClientSocket::~ClientSocket ( ) [virtual]

virtual RESULT gaia::net::ClientSocket::getOption ( SocketOptionName  optName,
int32_t *  optValue 
) [virtual]

Gets an option of the socket.

ClientSocket options determine the behavior of the current socket. Upon successful completion of this method, optValue shall contain the value of the specified ClientSocket option. For an option with a bool data type, a non-zero value is returned if the option is enabled. Otherwise, a zero value is returned. For an option with an integer data type, the method returns the appropriate value. ClientSocket options are grouped by the level of protocol support. Listed below are the various ClientSocket options that can be obtained using this overload. The option you choose to get must be specified in the optName parameter. If you want to set the current value of some of the options listed, use the setOption() method. NET_SOCKET_SO_RCVBUF: Buffer size for receives. NET_SOCKET_SO_SNDBUF: Buffer size for sends.

Parameters:
optNameName that specifies with value of option is going to be got.
optValuereturn the value of specified option.
Returns:
an error code.
virtual const gaia::base::Array<IPEndPoint>& gaia::net::ClientSocket::getPeerEndPoints ( ) const [virtual]

Returns:
peer's IPEndPoint.
virtual IClientSocketListener* gaia::net::ClientSocket::getSocketListener ( ) [virtual]

Obtain a listener that is set to the socket.

Listener is used only when the socket is set to be nonblock.

Parameters:
listenerlistener that to be removed.
Returns:
an error code.

virtual RESULT gaia::net::ClientSocket::receive ( gaia::base::ByteArray *  buffer,
size_t *  receivedLength 
) [virtual]

receive data and write to buffer.

Parameters:
bufferpointer of buffer.
receivedLengthAn output argument that tell caller how many bytes has been received at this receiving. This argument does not work in nonblocking mode. In nonblocking mode, length of received data is passed to listener.
Returns:
an error code.
virtual RESULT gaia::net::ClientSocket::send ( const gaia::base::ByteArray &  buffer,
size_t *  sentLength 
) [virtual]

send data to remote host.

Parameters:
bufferdata to be sent.
sentLengthLength of data that actually be sent. This argument does not work in nonblocking mode. In nonblocking mode, length of sent data is passed to listener.
Returns:
an error code.
virtual RESULT gaia::net::ClientSocket::setBlock ( bool  isBlock) [virtual]

set if this socket is blocking mode.

ClientSocket operates under non-blocking mode by default. Use setBlock to control if I/O is blocked.

Parameters:
isBlocktrue if this socket is going to be set to blocking mode.
Returns:
a error code.
virtual RESULT gaia::net::ClientSocket::setOption ( SocketOptionName  optName,
int32_t  value 
) [virtual]

Change option of socket.

The setOption() method is used to change the value of the option specified by the optionName parameter. Socket options determine the behavior of the current socket. For an option with a bool data type, a non-zero value must be specified to enable the option, and a zero value must be specified to disable the option. For an option with an integer data type, the appropriate value must be specified. Socket options are grouped by the level of protocol support. If you want to get the current value of some of the options listed, use getOption() method.

Parameters:
optNameName that specifies with value of option is going to be got.
valuereturn the value of specified option.
Returns:
an error code.
virtual RESULT gaia::net::ClientSocket::setSocketListener ( IClientSocketListener *  listener) [virtual]

Set a listener to the socket.

ClientSocket isn't responsible for deleting the listener.

Listener is used only when the socket is set to be nonblock.

Parameters:
listenerreference to a IClientSocketListener.
Returns:
an error code.
